column1: #Text=A polycrystalline sample (0.3 g) of Nb0.18Re0.82 was prepared by melting stoichiometric amounts of high purity niobium powder (99.95 % Alfa Aesar) and rhenium shot (99.999 % Alfa Aesar) under flowing ultra-high-purity argon gas in an arc-melter using a tungsten electrode and a water-cooled copper hearth.
#Text=A Zr button was utilized as an oxygen getter and melted before each synthesis.
#Text=First, Nb and Re buttons were made by arc melting the Nb and Re powder alone.
#Text=The Nb and Re buttons were then melted together to make a single button of Nb0.18Re0.82.
#Text=The sample was inverted and re-melted several times to ensure homogeneous mixing of the constituent elements.
#Text=The sample formed a hard pellet with a negligible mass loss.

#Text=We made more than 5 samples with different concentrations of Nb and Re in order to synthesize the stoichiometric compound and to check the effects of off-stoichiometry on the superconducting transition temperature Tc.
